intro: Clidemia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower bignonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Clidemia densiflora is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
